data.title: List of tablets with OLED displays
data.meta_description: OLED technology enables the world's best displays, and as OLEDs can be made flexible, light, thin and highly efficient, these displays are taking over many markets such as smartphones, TVs, VR and wearables. Another field where OLED displays are being adopted is the tablet market.ImageAMOLED displays traditionally found it more difficult to penetrate the tablet market as larger displays are more expensive to produce. But this is changing as OLED displays production costs are coming down. Samsung is leading the OLED tablet market, and its high-end Galaxy Tab tablet models are mostly using AMOLED displays. Other companies are also introduce AMOLED displays in tablet devices. It is reported that Apple will release its first OLED iPad at 2024. For more information and our news coverage on OLED tablets, click here.Following is a list of tablets with OLED displays:
data.text:
Huawei's MatePad Pro 12.2 (2024) is a high-end tablet that offers a 12.2" 2000 nits 144Hz 2800x1840 tandem-stack AMOLED display, which Huawei says offers 3X the lifetime of standard AMOLEDs, and a 33% improvement in power consumption. The MatePad Pro 12.2 offers up to 16GB of RAM and up to 1TB of storage.

The MatePad Pro 12.2 will ship soon in China starting at around $600.

Honor's MagicPad 2 android tablet offers a 12.3" 144Hz 1,600 nits 1920x3000 AMOLED display, a Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 chipset, up to 16GB of RAM and up to 1TB of storage.

The MagicPad 2 will ship by the end of July 2024, starting at around $400.

Microsoft's Surface Pro 11 is the first Surface tablet that has an OLED display (optional) - a 13" 120Hz 900 nits (peak) 2880x1920 AMOLED, produced by Samsung Display. Other specifications of this Copilot+ tablet include a Snapdragon X chipset, up to 32GB of RAM, up to 1TB of storage, and a Qualcomm Adreno graphic chipset.

The Surface Pro 11 with OLED starts at $1,499 and will ship on June 18.

The Xencelabs Pen Display 16 is a tablet for photographers and content creators, that offers a 16" 4K AMOLED display with a non-reflective surface and high color accuracy. It comes with two pressure-sensitive pens. The premium edition comes with a small remote that also includes a small white PMOLED (it can also be ordered separately).

The Xencelabs Pen Display 16 will ship soon starting at $999. The small PMOLED remote costs $99.

Apple's 2024 iPad Pro devices both feature OLED displays, Ultra Retina Tandem OLEDs. These are 11" 1668x2420 or 13" 2064x2752 and offer 120Hz, 1600 nits peak brightness and a tandem architecture. Other specifications include Apple's new M4 chipset, up to 2TB of storage and up to 16GB of RAM. The 13" model is 5.1 mm thick - Apple's thinnest device ever. Some of the models offer a matte finish (nano-texture glass coating).

The Apple iPad Pro 2024 devices will ship on May 15, starting at $999 for the 11-inch model.

NEC's Lavie Tab T14 is a large Android tablet, that offers a 14.5" 120Hz 1876x3000 AMOLED display, an 8-core MediaTek Dimensity 9000 chipset, 12GB of RAM, 256 GB of storage and eight JBL speakers.

The Lavie Tab T14 is now shipping in Japan for around $950.

Huawei's MatePad Pro is a 13.2″ flagship HarmonyOS 4 tablet, that offers a 13.2" 144Hz 2880 x 1920 flexible AMOLED display (with the highest screen-to-body ratio in the industry at 94%), a Kirin 9000s chipset, 12/16 GB of RAM, 256/512/1024 GB of internal storage, and a high-end cooling system.

The MatePad Pro is now shipping in China, starting at around $700.

Samsung's Galaxy Tab S9 series, made out of 3 devices (Tab S9, Tab S9 Plus, Tab S9 Ultra) are all based on AMOLED displays. The Tab S9 offers an 11" 120Hz 1600x2560 AMOLED display, the S9 Plus offers a 12.4" 120Hz 1752x2800 AMOLED and the S9 Ultra offers a 14.6" 120Hz 1848x2960 AMOLED display. The tablets are all powered by a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chipset, and are all dust and water resistant.

The Tab S9 series are now shipping starting at $799 for the Tab S9.

Lenovo's Tab Extreme is a premium tablet that offers a large 14.5" 3K 120Hz AMOLED display, Android 13 OS, 8-core Mediatek Dimensity 9000 chipset, 12GB of RAM and 256GB of storage.

Lenovo did not yet announce the price or availability of the Tab Extreme.
